Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday November 25), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, november 25th. 

first up, amazon is rolling out its latest grocery store concept without cashiers—again. following its initial prime member-only store debut, the company is extending its "amazon fresh" stores to several new urban locations. this move comes as amazon aims to enhance customer convenience and gather shopping data to hone its ai-driven inventory and customer experience strategies.

in the world of social media, meta, formerly facebook, has announced plans to introduce more family-friendly ai tools across its platforms. ceo mark zuckerberg highlighted during a recent conference that these enhancements are designed to make the platforms safer and more engaging, aiming to curb the ongoing criticism about user safety and data privacy concerns.

microsoft shares are seeing a slight uptick today after unveiling its new ai-powered analytics suite aimed at enterprises. the software, set for a 2024 launch, promises to revolutionize how businesses approach data-driven decision-making, tapping into machine learning to offer unprecedented analytic insights.

lastly, in the semiconductor sector, intel is back in the headlines as it outlines a bold new strategy to regain its market dominance. the chipmaker is investing heavily in ai technology and diversifying its production capabilities, signaling a shift towards capturing more market share in the burgeoning ai sector.

that's all for today. we’ll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, november 25th.

kicking off with amazon, the retail giant is expanding its "amazon fresh" cashier-less grocery store concept to more urban locations. this move follows the initial launch for prime members and underscores amazon’s push to enhance customer convenience and refine its ai-driven inventory and customer experience strategies by gathering key shopping data.

in social media news, meta, previously known as facebook, is set to introduce more family-friendly ai tools across its platforms. ceo mark zuckerberg announced at a recent conference that these enhancements aim to make the platforms safer and more engaging, addressing ongoing concerns about user safety and data privacy.

on to microsoft, whose shares have seen a slight uptick following the announcement of its new ai-powered analytics suite tailored for enterprises. scheduled for a 2024 launch, this suite promises to transform business approaches to data-driven decision-making by leveraging machine learning to deliver unprecedented analytical insights.

lastly, over in the semiconductor industry, intel is making headlines with a bold strategy aimed at regaining market dominance. the chipmaker is significantly investing in ai technology and diversifying its production capabilities, signaling a strategic shift to capture more market share in the booming ai sector.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-158 Amazon's Cashier-less Grocery Expansion 🛒, Meta's Family-friendly Ai Tools 🤖, Intel's Market Comeback Strategy 💡
Podcast Description:
```html

welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, november 25th! today's insightful discussions include:

  • amazon fresh expansion: extending its cashier-less grocery concept to urban areas, amazon aims to enhance customer convenience and refine ai strategies with this strategic move.
  • meta's ai tools upgrade: introduction of family-friendly ai tools across platforms to improve safety and engagement, as announced by mark zuckerberg.
  • microsoft ai analytics suite: unveiling a new ai-powered analytics tool for enterprises set for a 2024 launch, aimed at revolutionizing data-driven business decision-making.
  • intel's ai-driven strategy: investing heavily in ai technology and diversifying production to regain market dominance in the semiconductor industry.

join us tomorrow for more tech insights!

```
